page.title: 09BUILTH (W) : HOUSING
page.content: Builth (W) is the newer part of the town of Builth Wells. The older houses date from about 1900.They are often stone built,and with slate roofs.Several of them are three storeys high and follow a pattern of ribbon development. Council estates were built at Western Grove,and at Pendre,soon after the Second World War.There ,houses are generally semi-detached. The 1970's and early 80's saw the town undergoing rapid peripheral expansion.High cost housing,especially bungalows,is typical.This latent expansion reflects retirement into the area,also movement of buisness people out from above shop flats,and the expansion of local government in nearby Llandrindod Wells.
